thread.title: Jimmy Fallon's 2017 Golden Globe opening monologue filled with Donald Trump zingers
thread.title_full: Jimmy Fallon's 2017 Golden Globe opening monologue filled with Donald Trump zingers

title: Jimmy Fallon's 2017 Golden Globe opening monologue filled with Donald Trump zingers

organizations.name: michael kovac/getty images for moet & chandon

text:
Jimmy Fallon's 2017 Golden Globe opening monologue filled with Donald Trump zingers Before you go, we thought you'd like these... Jan 8th 2017 8:26PM 
Jimmy Fallon didn't hold back in his 2017 Golden Globe Award opening monologue. 
The comedian and late night host opened the award show with a celebrity-filled number on the red carpet with cameos from Nicole Kidman, Kit Harrington, the "Stranger Things" kids, and more big names before dancing onto the stage with Justin Timberlake. 
In a funny bit he and Timberlake dirty danced in the stars ala a more mature version of Ryan Gosling and Emma Stone's number in their Golden Globe-nominated flick. Then he played piano for Ryan Gosling before hitting the stage. 
Once he was on stage, the comedian took aim at president-elect Donald Trump in a slew of zingers. 
"Already you have your Golden Globes moment," Fallon told the audience. "This is one of the few places left where America still honors the popular vote." 
PHOTOS: Inside the Golden Globe Awards 11 PHOTOS Inside the Golden Globe Awards 2017 See Gallery Inside the Golden Globe Awards 2017 BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actress Amy Schumer (L) and Ben Hanisch attend the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Michael Kovac/Getty Images for Moet & Chandon ) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actors Susan Kelechi Watson (L) and Milo Ventimiglia at the 74th annual Golden Globe Awards sponsored by FIJI Water at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Charley Gallay/Getty Images for FIJI Water) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: 74th ANNUAL GOLDEN GLOBE AWARDS -- Pictured: Actress Jessica Chastain arrives to the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards held at the Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017. (Photo by Trae Patton/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Managing Director Starz Network Carmi Zlotnik and Elizabeth Zlotnik attend the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Todd Williamson/Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actors Sterling K. Brown (L), John Travolta, Milo Ventimiglia, and Kelly Preston at the 74th annual Golden Globe Awards sponsored by FIJI Water at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Charley Gallay/Getty Images for FIJI Water) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actresses Kerry Washington and Lily Collins at the 74th annual Golden Globe Awards sponsored by FIJI Water at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Charley Gallay/Getty Images for FIJI Water) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: (L-R) Brie Larson, Alex Greenwald, and Eddie Redmayne attend the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Michael Kovac/Getty Images for Moet & Chandon ) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actors Jonah Hill and Laura Dern attend the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Michael Kovac/Getty Images for Moet & Chandon ) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actress Zoe Saldana (L) and Marco Perego attend the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Joe Scarnici/Getty Images for Moet & Chandon ) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actress Octavia Spencer at the 74th annual Golden Globe Awards sponsored by FIJI Water at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Jonathan Leibson/Getty Images for FIJI Water) Up Next BACK TO SLIDE SHOW CAPTION 
He then joked that the night would be filled with thank yous to people like Ryan Murphy and people's agents, but nobody would be thanking O.J. Simpson. In fact, he claimed, people were dealing with a lot of confusion this year – including confusion about big nominee "Game of Thrones." 
"'Game of Thrones' is nominated for a ton of awards, and a lot of people have wondered what it would be like King Joffrey had lived and in 12 days we're going to find out. " 
Ouch – that one was pointed at Mr. Trump again. 
Next, Fallon kidded about the Casey Affleck movie, "Manchester By the Sea" calling it one of the most depressing films of the year. 
"You might remember 'Manchester By the Sea' as the most depressing movie of 2016, and the only thing more depressing than 2016." 
Fallon closed out the monologue by letting everyone know that the votes would be calculated by the accounting firm, "Ernst and Young and Putin." 
Way to end it with a relative bang, Fallon. 
PHOTOS: See all the 2017 red carpet arrivals 93 PHOTOS Golden Globes 2017: Red carpet arrivals See Gallery Golden Globes 2017: Red carpet arrivals 
Jessica Biel definitely made heads turn in this gown complete with a plunging neckline and thigh-high slit ... but we're not sold on the bizarre detailing on the bottom half. 
(Photo by Kevork Djansezian/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) 
"This Is Us" actress Mandy Moore surprised everyone with a seriously sexy black dress with a unique train and plunging neckline. 
(Photo by Neilson Barnard/NBCUniversal/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) 
Nicole Kidman and her husband Keith Urban dazzle on the red carpet in a long, metallic gown and sharp black tuxedo respectively. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Anna Kendrick turned heads in a sea of black dresses in a sheer grey gown with a long train. We're totally loving this simple, yet sophisticated, ensemble. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Wow! Lily Collins made a statement in a stunning rose pink gown with some unique embellishments. She paired the dramatic look with a sexy red lip. 
(Reuters) 
Fierce! Kerry Washington channeled her "Scandal" character Olivia Pope in this yellow Dolce & Gabbana number that gave a subtle view of her undergarments. 
(Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) 
Actress Regina King gave us serious body goals (take a look at those arms!) in a body-hugging silver strapless gown. Give us the number to her trainer ASAP. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Stunning! Pregnant Natalie Portman channeled Jackie Kennedy in this eye-catching mustard yellow gown with intricate white embroidery. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
Actress Gina Rodriguez looks glamorous and channels old Hollywood with her finger wave curls and sparkly dress. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Winona Ryder went safe with a black gown with a sweetheart neckline and a dramatic train. She left her raven tresses down with a subtle red lip. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
Actress Kristen Wiig rocks a long, white lace gown complete with short bell sleeves and gold jewelry. 
(Photo by Kevork Djansezian/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) 
Sarah Jessica Parker seemingly plays tribute to the late Carrie fisher in a white gown and braided up do that resembles Princess Leia' s iconic "Star Wars" buns. 
(Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) Reese Witherspoon stuns in a yellow strapless gown, complete with a sexy thigh-high slit. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
"Nashville" actress Connie Britton looks pretty in pink in floral gown and thigh-high slit. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actress Emma Stone attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
Viola Davis looks gorgeous in a yellow, one-shoulder dress complete with diamond drop-down earrings. 
(Photo by Kevork Djansezian/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) 
Kelly Preston made heads turn in all the wrong ways in this black and white ensemble with ruffles on the bottom. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Sexy lady! Sofia Vergara left little to the imagination in a super sheer number with some bedazzled detailing. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Carrie Underwood showed off her teeny figure in a pastel pink number with some strange ruffled detailing up top. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
"Black-ish" star Tracee Ellis Ross took a risk with her sheer strapless gown -- and it paid off! Ross proudly flashed a hint off a hint of leg in the see-through number. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Woah, cleavage! Priyanka Chopra blew us away with this stunning long-sleeved gold gown that hugged her toned body in all the right places. 
(Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) 
Look at those arms! Felicity Huffman gave us some serious Greek goddess vibes in this gold and white pantsuit with a surprise slit on the bottom. 
(Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) 
Natalie Morales sparkled in this silver ensemble with a subtle slit. She carried a clutch of the same hue. Doesn't she look incredible? 
(Photo by Kevork Djansezian/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) 
Hailee Steinfeld proved she's a force to be reckoned with on the red carpet in this nearly see-through dreamy purple ensemble. 
Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) 
Ruth Negga looked out-of-this-world in this figure-hugging cosmic number. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Michael Keaton rocked some shades to go along with his sleek black tux. 
(Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) 
Michelle Williams underwhelmed with an off-the-shoulder patterned frock. Instead of rocking diamonds, she opted for her own unique take on the choker. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Leading lady Amy Adams rocked an understated sequined black dress with a unique neckline. 
(Photo by Neilson Barnard/NBCUniversal/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) 
Model Heidi Klum rocked another body-hugging ensemble -- but this black and white frock totally missed the mark. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Pretty in pink! Red carpet veteran Angela Bassett didn't disappoint in a floor-length gown with a unique neckline. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
Octavia Spencer decided to ditch the gown with this navy blazer and pants of the same color. 
(Photo by Kevork Djansezian/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) 
Wowza! Emily Ratajkowski continued her streak of jaw-dropping red carpet looks in a daring yellow gown that showed off her perfect figure. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
"This Is Us" star Chrissy Metz made heads turn in a deep purple ensemble with an embellished waistline. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
"Fantastic Beasts" actor Eddie Redmayne looks handsome in a sharp tuxedo and classic black bow-tie. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Actress Sarah Paulson slinky long-sleeved gold dress hugged her tiny frame in all the right places. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
Chrissy Teigen left us disappointed with this bizarre metallic ensemble. The peplum waist was the cherry on top of the disaster look. 
(Photo by Kevork Djansezian/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) 
Wowza. Naomi Campbell slays the red carpet with a geometric dress dazzling to the eye. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Donald Glover went against the status quo in this brown velvet tux. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Lady in red! Charissa Thompson stunned in a sexy floor-length gown with a plunging neckline. 
(Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) 
Anna Chlumsky stunned in an emerald green frock that hugged her tiny waist. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Thandie Newton was a vision in white in a tight off-the-shoulder with gold detailing on the bottom. 
(Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) 
Flower power! Busy Philipps' black gown is a definite winner. She paired the eye-catching look with a bright yellow boxed clutch. 
(Photo by Neilson Barnard/NBCUniversal/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) 
Riley Keough went bold with this black gown complete with a unique neckline -- it'll have everyone talking for days! 
(Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) 
Jenna Bush Hager was all smiles in a simple emerald green off-the-shoulder look at her very first Golden Globes! 
(Photo credit should read VALERIE MACON/AFP/Getty Images) 
Actress Zoe Saldana made a statement in this ruffled Gucci ensemble made up of different shades of pink ... but we're not sold. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
TV personality Liz Hernandez hit the red carpet wearing a unique black gown ... but we're not too entirely sure what's going on here. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
The "Stranger Things" cast sure knows how to clean up! Caleb McLaughlin, Finn Wolfhard, Noah Schnapp and Gaten Matarazzo looked like total red carpet pros with their outfits. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Bombshell! TV personality Nancy O'Dell rocked head to toe purple in a sexy gown with a deep-V neckline and a thigh-high slit. She rocked heels of the same color. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
Stripes done right! Julia Louis-Dreyfus' looked totally elegant in this black and white one-shoulder ensemble. 
(Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) 
Actress Amy Landecker got totally busty in a gorgeous cream gown with a small train. 
(Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) 
TV personality Tracey E. Edmonds flashed some major cleavage in a figure-hugging gown with a peplum waistline. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
Sienna Miller was a vision in white in a simple gown with some seriously sexy cutouts near the waist. She completed the sophisticated look with a pearl necklace and a black clutch. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Jeannie Mai hit the red carpet in a dramatic textured gown with a soft pink belt. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
TV Personality AJ Gibson looked totally dapper in a navy tux complete with a black bowtie. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) Renee Bargh arrives at the 74th annual Golden Globe Awards at the Beverly Hilton Hotel in Beverly Hills, California on January 8, 2017. / AFP / VALERIE MACON (Photo credit should read VALERIE MACON/AFP/Getty Images) 
Yvette Nicole Brown sparkled in this eye-catching long-sleeved rose gold number. 
(Photo credit should read VALERIE MACON/AFP/Getty Images) 
Actress Jessica Chastain rocks a frosty blue, floral fitted gown complete with a drop-down dazzling diamond necklace. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Olivia Culpo looked like a a piece of art in this dramatic gown with floral patterning that looked similar to a Van Gogh painting. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Ross Mathews hit the red carpet in style in a black suit, sans bowtie, and his million-dollar smile. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Zazie Beetz rocked a simple black dress with a billowy bottom. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
The Stallone daughters, Sistine, Scarlet and Sophia, look all grown up! The trio, who shared the "Miss Golden Globes" honors, all wore simple black dresses while accessorizing with some major bling. 
(Photo by Neilson Barnard/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) 
Can she do wrong? Gymnast Simone Biles was all smiles on the red carpet in a cream ensemble with with sparkly detailing on the waist -- in yet another flawless look. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Hello ladies! Josh Henderson rocked a sleek black tuxedo complete with a slicked-back hairstyle. 
(Photo by Kevork Djansezian/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) 
Stunning! Felicity Jones looked absolutely gorgeous in this pastel pink Gucci gown. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actress Teresa Palmer attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Trace Lysette looked like an absolute bombshell in a figure-hugging emerald green gown. She kept everything else simple as to not pull attention away from the intricate detailing. 
(Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actor Joel Edgerton attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Drew Barrymore looked stunning in a sheer all-white number with silver detailing on the sleeves. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
"Stranger Things" actress Millie Bobby Brown rocked a knee-length silver frock with fringe embellishments. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
Kristen Bell flaunted her perfect figure in a body-hugging long-sleeved gown with a dramatic neckline. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actress Amara Karan attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: 74th ANNUAL GOLDEN GLOBE AWARDS -- Pictured: Actress Kat Kramer arrives to the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards held at the Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017. (Photo by Christopher Polk/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: 74th ANNUAL GOLDEN GLOBE AWARDS -- Pictured: (l-r) Actor Jon Falcone and television host Debbie Matenopoulos arrive to the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards held at the Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017. (Photo by Kevork Djansezian/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Joel Edgerton attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actor Trevante Rhodes attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actor Ron Cephas Jones attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actress Judith Light attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Jeremy Renner attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actor Malcolm McDowell attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) Diana Madison attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Venturelli/WireImage) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actor Milo Ventimiglia attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: 74th ANNUAL GOLDEN GLOBE AWARDS -- Pictured: Actor Justin Hartley arrives to the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards held at the Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017. (Photo by Kevork Djansezian/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: 74th ANNUAL GOLDEN GLOBE AWARDS -- Pictured: (l-r) Singer/actor Justin Timberlake arrives to the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards held at the Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017. (Photo by Kevork Djansezian/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actress Amanda Peet attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
Sophie Turner's complicated black and white gown missed the mark in more ways than one. Where do we even begin? 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Producer J.J. Abrams dressed to impress in his all-black tux. 
(Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
Issa Rae couldn't be missed in this bright white ensemble that hugged her curvaceous body. 
(Photo by Kevork Djansezian/NBC/NBCU Photo Bank via Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Gymnast Aly Raisman attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actress Gal Gadot attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JANUARY 08: Actress Laura Dern attends the 74th Annual Golden Globe Awards at The Beverly Hilton Hotel on January 8, 2017 in Beverly Hills, California. (Photo by Steve Granitz/WireImage) 
Evan Rachel Wood looks beautiful in a sharp-tailored tuxedo complete with a bow-tie blouse and minimal jewelry. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Luciana Barroso and actor Matt Damon keep it classic on the red carpet with a black and white ensemble. 
(Photo by Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) Up Next
